issues.title: Zooming and scaling must not be disabled
issues.description: Ensure <meta name="viewport"> does not disable text scaling and zooming

any.message: user-scalable on <meta> tag disables zooming on mobile devices

nodes.html: <meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, height=device-height, minimum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=0" name="viewport">
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  user-scalable on <meta> tag disables zooming on mobile devices

issues.title: `[user-scalable="no"]` is used in the `<meta name="viewport">` element or the `[maximum-scale]` attribute is less than 5.
issues.description: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more about the viewport meta tag](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/meta-viewport).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  user-scalable on <meta> tag disables zooming on mobile devices

issues.title: This fieldset element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: legend element, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description:
<fieldset>
         <input id="search-inp...</fieldset>

original_issue.message: This fieldset element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: legend element, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input id="search-input" name="q" placeholder="Search..." type="text">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description: <input id="search-input" name="q" placeholder="Search..." type="text">

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
